articles.title: 3 charts that show Palantir's astronomical growth over the last five years
articles.description: The artificial intelligence-powered software company's cofounders include renowned venture capitalist Peter Thiel and current CEO Alex Karp.
articles.html_content: Latest NewsSVB NewsLIVEAnalyst RatingsFDA ApprovalsMerger & AcquisitionsSearch by:Symbol(s)Comma-seperate tickers for multi-ticker search. Use*to search for articles mentioning at least 1 ticker.KeywordsElon Musklooks for "Elon" OR "Musk"Put phrase inside quotes for an exact match. This is particularly useful for names:"Elon Musk","FDA Approval"Use the minus (-) operator to exclude results which match specific keywords:"Elon Musk" -TeslaUse*as wildcard to match any character:acqui*matchesacquireandacquisitionUse AND to search for multiple keywords in the same article:Tesla AND "Elon Musk"Use OR to search for multiple keywords in the same article:"Elon Musk" OR "Jack Dorsey"Source(s)Select...Search11 hours ago |August 14, 2025 at 5:05 PM UTC| CNBC3 charts that show Palantir's astronomical growth over the last five yearsPLTRGSAAPLMSFTNVDATSLAShareTwitterFacebookLinkedInEmailCopy LinkSummaryPalantir shares have increased by over 1,700% since its 2020 NYSE debut.Government contracts, particularly with the U.S. Department of Defense, are major revenue drivers.Palantir's market valuation exceeds $430 billion, reaching new highs among tech peers.The company's shares have remained above $100 since April 2025, with retail investors contributing significantly.U.S. government revenue grew 53% to $426 million last quarter, accounting for 55% of total revenue.A $10 billion contract with the U.S. Army was signed recently for data & software services.U.S. revenues have increased from $156 million to $733 million in five years, while international revenues doubled to $271 million.Palantir reported over $1 billion in quarterly revenue for the first time, with a forward PE ratio exceeding 280 times.Palantir's stock is among the top 10 U.S. tech firms & top 20 most valuable U.S. companies despite lower revenue compared to peers.Link to original articleSearch by:Symbol(s)Comma-seperate tickers for multi-ticker search.
